headline: Here’s What the Big Bank CEOs Got Paid in 2025
summary: The chief executives of the largest U.S. banks together raked in $258 million in compensation for 2025, after a strong economy and buoyant Wall Street propelled their businesses to record levels.  Morgan Stanley’s  Ted Pick  and Wells Fargo’s  Charlie Scharf  saw the biggest pay bumps at 32% and 28%, respectively.  Citigroup CEO  Jane Fraser’s  pay rose 22%, and BofA’s  Brian Moynihan  was given 17% more than the previous year.

headline: FactSet (FDS) Target Lowered by Wells Fargo Amid AI Concerns in Info Services
summary: FactSet Research Systems Inc. (NYSE:FDS) is included among the 13 Cheapest Dividend Aristocrats to Invest in. On February 4, Wells Fargo cut its price target on FactSet Research Systems Inc. (NYSE:FDS) to $215 from $265 and maintained an Underweight rating. The move came after broader weakness in the information services space. Stocks in the group […]

headline: Treasury Secretary Bessent Says Crypto Volatility Is 'Self-Induced' After Criticizing Coinbase For Clarity Bill Opposition
summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent called recent cryptocurrency market volatility “self-induced” during a Friday interview on CNBC’s “Squawk Box,” placing blame squarely on industry players blocking the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act.

headline: Is ServiceTitan’s Expanded Revolver And Leverage‑Linked Covenants Quietly Reframing Its Capital Flexibility Narrative (TTAN)?
summary: On January 30, 2026, ServiceTitan, Inc. amended its 2023 credit agreement with Wells Fargo, lifting its revolving credit facility from US$140 million to US$250 million, extending the term to January 30, 2031, and tying pricing and unused commitment fees to total net leverage while introducing more flexible covenants. By voluntarily repaying the prior US$107 million term loan and ending the period with no borrowings under the amended facility, ServiceTitan has created a larger, undrawn...
